title: Suffolk Coast Path
text:
The Suffolk Coast Path is a <a href="long-distance%20footpath">long-distance footpath</a> along the <a href="Suffolk">Suffolk</a> <a href="Heritage%20Coast">Heritage Coast</a> in England. It is long.
Previously known as the Suffolk Coast and Heaths Path after the <a href="Suffolk%20Coast%20and%20Heaths">Suffolk Coast and Heaths Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty</a> through which it runs, the path has been rebranded with new waymarkers bearing the new name. <a href="https%3A//www.flickr.com/photos/dale65/3393554968/"></a><a href="https%3A//www.flickr.com/photos/omcoc/3237114905/"></a>
The path runs along river and sea walls, across <a href="marsh">marsh</a>, <a href="heath%20%28habitat%29">heath</a>, foreshore and cliffs. It starts at <a href="Felixstowe">Felixstowe</a> and ends at <a href="Lowestoft">Lowestoft</a> , via <a href="Bawdsey">Bawdsey</a>, <a href="Snape%20Maltings">Snape Maltings</a>, <a href="Aldeburgh">Aldeburgh</a>, <a href="North%20Warren%20RSPB%20reserve">North Warren</a>, <a href="Thorpeness">Thorpeness</a>, <a href="Minsmere">Minsmere</a>, <a href="Dunwich">Dunwich</a>, <a href="Southwold">Southwold</a> and <a href="Kessingland">Kessingland</a>. It connects with the <a href="Sandlings%20Walk">Sandlings Walk</a> and (via the Stour and Orwell Walk) with the <a href="Essex%20Way">Essex Way</a> and the <a href="Stour%20Valley%20Path">Stour Valley Path</a>.
Much of <a href="W.%20G.%20Sebald">W. G. Sebald</a>'s novel <a href="The%20Rings%20of%20Saturn">The Rings of Saturn</a> describes a walking tour that roughly follows the Suffolk Coast Path.
